head.title: Treasury Bills Scheduled for This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Bills Scheduled for This Week
hedline.hl2: Treasury Bills Scheduled for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.13 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 5.16 percent. The rate on the four-week issue was 4.93 percent.
The Treasury’s schedule of financing this week includes today’s regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.13 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 5.16 percent. The rate on the four-week issue was 4.93 percent.
The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:

Plainfield, Ill., Community Consolidated School District No. 202, $86.7 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive. Round Rock, Tex., Independent School District, $103.1 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Washington State, $770.1 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Metropolitan Council, St. Paul, $80 million of wastewater general obligation bonds. Competitive. Virginia, $83.4 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
TAX EXEMPT ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK

Allen, Tex., Independent School District, $52.2 million of debt securities. Citigroup. Arizona State University, $77 million of debt securities. Lehman Brothers. Birdville, Tex., Independent School District, $103 million of school building bonds. UBS. California Health and Human Services Agency, $475 million of debt securities for Kaiser Permanente. Citigroup. Citrus County, Fla., Water and Wastewater System, $54 million of revenue bonds. Bank of America. Colorado Hospital Authority, $75 million of debt securities for University of Colorado. Citigroup. Dormitory Authority of the State of New York, $165.7 million of revenue bonds. Morgan Stanley. Ector County, Tex., Independent School District, $56.4 million of unlimited tax refunding bonds. First Southwest. Inglewood, Calif., Unified School District, $55 million of debt securities. Siebert Brandford Shank. Kentucky Housing Corporation, $50 million of housing revenue bonds. UBS. Midland, Tex., $56.7 million of certificate of obligation limited tax general obligation bonds. A.G. Edwards & Sons. Missouri Health and Educational Facilities Authority, $59 million of senior living facilities revenue bonds for Lutheran Senior Services. Ziegler Capital Markets. Missouri Housing Development Commission, $50 million of single-family mortgage revenue bonds for the homeownership loan program. George K. Baum. Nebraska Public Power District, $500 million of debt securities for the Whelan Energy Center. Bear Stearns. New Jersey Tobacco Settlement Finance Corporation, $3.6 billion of debt securities. Bear Stearns. New Mexico Mortgage Finance Authority, $50 million of debt securities for the single-family mortgage program. George K. Baum. Roseville, Calif., $195 million of gas revenue bonds. Merrill Lynch. San Antonio, $350 million of water system revenue bonds. UBS. Spring Branch, Tex., Independent School District, $165 million of school building bonds. UBS. Sprinfield, Mass., $140 million of general obligation bonds. UBS. Walton County, Ga., $59 million of debt securities. Citigroup. Washington, D.C., Convention Center Authority, $482.6 million of debt securities. Morgan Stanley.
